bibliographic_metadata.Title: Mineral prospectivity mapping based on Support vector machine and Random Forest algorithm – A case study from Ashele copper–zinc deposit, Xinjiang, NW China
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Chaojie Zheng, Feng Yuan, Xianrong Luo, Xiaohui Li, Panfeng Liu, Meilan Wen, Zesu Chen, Stefano Albanese

abstract: This study investigates the use of machine learning techniques for mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM) at the Ashele copper-zinc deposit. By enhancing feature representativeness and analyzing dataset composition, the study constructs predictive models using Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Random Forest (RF) algorithms. The results indicate that improved feature selection significantly enhances model performance, achieving predictive accuracies of approximately 0.88. The integrated model successfully identifies mineralized boreholes, demonstrating the efficacy of machine learning in MPM.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > kernel-based > support vector machine
key_points: Machine learning techniques enhance mineral prospectivity mapping.
Support Vector Machine and Random Forest algorithms were utilized.
Improved feature representativeness significantly boosts model performance.
Integrated model identified 98% of mineralized boreholes in the top 15% of the study area.
